column1: Art Institute of Chicago////What struck me was how sacred it feels; hushed
column4: rather than taking in the art at face value
column5: I saw the contexts of the compositions. Pieces from WWI and WWII being dark
column7: abstract. Pieces from the 20's being straight and geometric trying to find some structure
column8: in such a zany decade. The tongue in cheek nature of pop art riffing on the cultural and sociological climate.
